column2: Different races have different lifespans, elves normally live more than 300 years, dwarves no more than 150 years, and halflings up to 100 years.
If you have problems with monsters hire a witcher, but don't expect him to stay long - witchers go where there is work for them.
Humans can change Crown Laws once per lifetime, but those with a longer lifespan can change them once every 20 years.
The longest living race isn't elves or dwarves, but sorcerers - they can live for centuries.
Elves reach maturity and can have children at the age of 50.
Artifacts and other items of value are not passed along the titles but within dynasty instead.
Owning a legendary sword or armor increases your chance of victory in duels.
Even if you have multiple swords in duel you can use only one or with Ambidextrous trait - two swords.
If you take a ward you also have to pay for his education.
Weak claims can be pressed freely against empires with low Imperial Authority.
Empires with very low Imperial Authority can be destroyed if there is no suitable heir for current succession law.
